description: From Old French sufisanz, soficient, from Latin sufficiēns, present participle of sufficiō.

adjectives.description: sufficient (comparative more sufficient, superlative most sufficient)

entries.meaning: Of a type or kind that suffices, that satisfies requirements or needs.
examples: This is a necessary condition but not a sufficient one.

entries.meaning: Possessing adequate talents or accomplishments; of competent power or ability; qualified; fit.

examples: ...to take the best ways we can, to make it known to the Duke of York; for, till Sir J. Minnes be removed, and a sufficient man brought into W. Pen's place, when he is gone, it is impossible for this Office ever to support itself.

entries.meaning: (obsolete) Having enough money to meet obligations and live comfortably.
